findings.issue: Seismic design references ASCE/SEI 7 without specifying the edition year. For DSA projects under CBC 2022, this must reference ASCE 7-22. Additionally, the section lacks required DSA seismic certification requirements including reference to DSA IR A-6 and OSHPD OPA pre-approval documentation for seismic restraints.
findings.existingText: Design seismic-restraint hangers and supports for piping and equipment.
findings.replacementText: Design seismic-restraint hangers and supports for piping and equipment in accordance with ASCE 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022, DSA IR A-6, and applicable OSHPD OPA requirements. Submit seismic certification documentation for all restraint components.

findings.issue: Missing requirement for DSA seismic certification submittals. DSA projects require seismic restraint components to have proper certification documentation per DSA IR A-6.
findings.replacementText: Seismic Certification: Submit manufacturer's seismic certification for hangers, supports, and anchorage components per DSA IR A-6. Include OSHPD pre-approval (OPA) documentation where applicable.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: References outdated standard name 'ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1'. IESNA was dropped from the standard title in 2010. For California projects, should reference California Energy Code (Title 24 Part 6) or ASHRAE 90.1-2022 as the basis for energy compliance.
findings.existingText: ASHRAE/IESNA Compliance:  Applicable requirements in ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing."
findings.replacementText: Energy Code Compliance: Applicable requirements in California Energy Code (Title 24 Part 6) and ASHRAE 90.1-2022, Section 6.7.2.3 - "System Balancing."

findings.issue: References MIL-A-3316C which was last updated in 1987 and has been cancelled. This military specification is obsolete and should be replaced with current commercial standards.
findings.existingText: Mineral-Fiber Adhesive:  Comply with MIL-A-3316C, Class 2, Grade A.
findings.replacementText: Mineral-Fiber Adhesive: Comply with ASTM C1338 for fungal resistance and manufacturer's recommendations for adhesion and temperature range suitable for intended service.

findings.issue: References outdated 'California Department of Health Services' standard. This program was transferred to California Department of Public Health (CDPH) and the current standard is CDPH Standard Method v1.2 for VOC emissions testing.
findings.existingText: California Department of Health Services' "Standard Practice for the Testing of Volatile Organic Emissions from Various Sources Using Small-Scale Environmental Chambers."
findings.replacementText: California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Standard Method v1.2 for testing VOC emissions from building materials.

findings.issue: Insulation thickness specifications do not vary by pipe size as required by California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 and ASHRAE 90.1. The schedules should specify minimum thicknesses based on pipe diameter ranges per the applicable energy code tables.
findings.existingText:
Chilled Water:

Insulation shall be the following:
...
Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I:  1 inch thick.
findings.replacementText:
Chilled Water:

Insulation shall be the following:
Mineral-Fiber, Preformed Pipe, Type I:
- NPS 1 and smaller: 1 inch thick
- NPS 1-1/4 to NPS 2: 1 inch thick
- NPS 2-1/2 to NPS 4: 1-1/2 inches thick
- NPS 5 to NPS 6: 1-1/2 inches thick
- NPS 8 and larger: 2 inches thick
Thicknesses shall comply with California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6, Table 120.3-A.
findings.codeReference: California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6, Table 120.3-A

findings.issue: Same outdated California Department of Health Services reference as duct insulation spec. Should reference current CDPH Standard Method v1.2.
findings.existingText: California Department of Health Services' "Standard Practice for the Testing of Volatile Organic Emissions from Various Sources Using Small-Scale Environmental Chambers."
findings.replacementText: California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Standard Method v1.2 for testing VOC emissions from building materials.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.section: Part 3, Pipe Label Installation, Pipe Label Color Schedule
findings.issue: Chilled-Water Piping has duplicate and contradictory Letter Color entries - lists both White and Black. This will cause confusion during installation.
findings.existingText:
Chilled-Water Piping:

Background Color:  Blue.

Letter Color:  White.

Letter Color:  Black.
findings.replacementText:
Chilled-Water Piping:

Background Color: Blue.

Letter Color: White.

findings.section: Part 3, Penetrations, Insulation Installation at Fire-Rated Wall and Partition Penetrations
findings.issue: Text contains corruption/typo: 'Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"irestopping' - appears to be a formatting error that makes the reference unclear.
findings.existingText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"irestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.
findings.replacementText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping" for firestopping and fire-resistive joint sealers.

findings.issue: References outdated 'ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1' standard name. Should reference California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6 for California projects, which adopts modified ASHRAE 90.1 requirements.
findings.existingText: Metal ducts with duct liner of sufficient thickness to comply with energy code and ASHRAE/IESNA 90.1.
findings.replacementText: Metal ducts with duct liner of sufficient thickness to comply with California Energy Code Title 24 Part 6.

findings.section: Part 2, Pipe Stands, High-Type Single-Pipe Stand
findings.issue: Specifies cadmium-plated steel for vertical members and horizontal members. Cadmium plating is being phased out due to environmental and health concerns and is increasingly restricted. Modern specifications typically specify zinc or stainless steel.
findings.existingText:
Vertical Members:  Two or more cadmium-plated-steel or stainless-steel, continuous-thread rods.

Horizontal Member:  Cadmium-plated-steel or stainless-steel rod with plastic or stainless-steel, roller-type pipe support.
findings.replacementText:
Vertical Members: Two or more hot-dip galvanized steel or stainless-steel, continuous-thread rods.

Horizontal Member: Hot-dip galvanized steel or stainless-steel rod with plastic or stainless-steel, roller-type pipe support.

findings.issue: Editor's note 'Retain definitions remaining after this Section has been edited' was not removed during specification editing. This instruction text should be deleted from the final specification.
findings.existingText: Retain definitions remaining after this Section has been edited.

findings.issue: Manufacturer list includes outdated company names. Cooper B-Line, Inc. is now nVent ERIFLEX/B-Line (acquired 2017). Thomas & Betts Corporation is now ABB Installation Products (acquired 2012).
findings.existingText:
Cooper B-Line, Inc.
...
Thomas & Betts Corporation.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Editor's note 'Retain definition(s) remaining after this Section has been edited' was not removed. This should be deleted from the final specification.
findings.existingText: Retain definition(s) remaining after this Section has been edited.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: TAB contractor qualifications only list AABC certification. NEBB (National Environmental Balancing Bureau) is an equally recognized certification body and should be included as an acceptable alternative.
findings.existingText: TAB Contractor Qualifications:  Engage a TAB entity certified by AABC.
findings.replacementText: TAB Contractor Qualifications: Engage a TAB entity certified by AABC or NEBB.

findings.section: Part 3, Outdoor, Underground Piping Insulation Schedule
findings.issue: This schedule article header exists but contains no actual insulation specifications for underground piping. It only contains editor notes about insulation types but no actual requirements. Either populate with requirements or delete if underground insulation is specified elsewhere.
findings.existingText:
OUTDOOR, UNDERGROUND PIPING INSULATION SCHEDULE

Insulation specified in this article is limited to those insulation types that have high compressive strength...

Loose-fill insulation, for belowground piping, is specified in Section 232113.13 "Underground Hydronic Piping".
findings.replacementText:
OUTDOOR, UNDERGROUND PIPING INSULATION SCHEDULE

Underground piping insulation: Refer to Section 232113.13 "Underground Hydronic Piping" for pre-insulated piping systems and loose-fill insulation requirements.

findings.issue: Specifies to install underground direct-buried jacket but does not specify the jacket type, material, or thickness. This is incomplete and non-enforceable.
findings.existingText: For underground direct-buried piping applications, install underground direct-buried jacket over insulation material.
findings.replacementText: For underground direct-buried piping applications, install underground direct-buried jacket over insulation material. Jacket shall be high-density polyethylene (HDPE), minimum 50 mils thick, factory-applied or field-applied with heat-shrink sleeves at joints.

findings.issue: VOC limit references federal 40 CFR 59 Subpart D but does not reference California-specific requirements. For California projects, adhesives should also comply with SCAQMD Rule 1168 or applicable local air district rules which may have stricter limits.
findings.existingText: For indoor applications, adhesive shall have a VOC content of 80 g/L or less when calculated according to 40 CFR 59, Subpart D (EPA Method 24).
findings.replacementText: For indoor applications, adhesive shall have a VOC content of 50 g/L or less when calculated according to 40 CFR 59, Subpart D (EPA Method 24) and shall comply with SCAQMD Rule 1168 or applicable local air quality management district rules.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Typo: 'At least 1-1/2 incheshigh' is missing a space between 'inches' and 'high'.
findings.existingText: Lettering Size:  At least 1-1/2 incheshigh.
findings.replacementText: Lettering Size: At least 1-1/2 inches high.

findings.issue: Editor's note 'Verify suitability of fasteners in this article for use in lightweight concrete or concrete slabs less than 4 inches (100 mm) thick' was not removed. This should be deleted or converted to a specification requirement.
findings.existingText: Verify suitability of fasteners in this article for use in lightweight concrete or concrete slabs less than 4 inches (100 mm) thick.

findings.issue: Editor's note 'Manufacturers' catalogs indicate that copper pipe hangers are small, typically NPS 4 (DN 100) or smaller, and types available are limited' appears to be specification guidance that was not removed.
findings.existingText: Manufacturers' catalogs indicate that copper pipe hangers are small, typically NPS 4 (DN 100) or smaller, and types available are limited.

findings.fileName: 230553 - IDENTIFICATION FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT.docx
findings.issue: Editor's note 'In first paragraph below, describe required label content...' was not removed from the specification.
findings.existingText: In first paragraph below, describe required label content.  The objective of labeling equipment is to coordinate it with Drawings, including plans, details, and schedules.  This will allow other information, such as capacities and operating characteristics, to be obtained.

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.section: Part 3, Final Report, General Report Data
findings.issue: The final report content requirements are excessively detailed and prescriptive, specifying every data point down to 'Sheave make, size in inches, and bore' and 'Center-to-center dimensions of sheave, and amount of adjustments in inches.' While comprehensive documentation is important, this level of detail is burdensome and many of these items are already captured in equipment submittals. Consider allowing TAB contractor to use their standard certified report format that meets AABC/NEBB requirements.

The hanger schedule lists 58 different MSS hanger types with detailed descriptions of each application. While technically thorough, this is essentially reproducing MSS SP-69 content in the specification. A simple reference to 'Select hanger types per MSS SP-69 for the application' would be clearer and reduce specification bloat.
